title: People trashtalking Riot for not playing the game LUL
body:
and then you realise the entire balance team is mostly d1 players
and then you realise that jinxylord can probably teach the game to any boards users here 

let's make something clear right there
if you want to call out the balance team for what they're doing then go ahead
but if you want to shittalk the balance team for not playing the game then don't kid yourself, they do play the game and A HUNDRED TIMES better than you and they can probably teach you how to not lose against yasuo or darius

I hit master tier every single season, this season i hit challenger, and I still don't know how to fixe the issues that are in league, wanna know why? that's fcking right because it's not something you can do in 5 minutes

but if you yourself know how to then by all means, tell to scarra and imaqtpie how to fixe adcs or supports, or things that they both don't know how they would fixe like tahm kench being broken in high elo/competition due to his W

but the most funny part is when bruisers absolutly tickle tanks and do not do jackshit to them, the boards and every toplaners complain about bruisers being a joke, riot fixe that by adding conqueror
and you STILL see people complaining about riot adding more damage to the game, are you fcking serious? you have A CLASS SUPPOSED TO DEAL DAMAGE NOT DOING DAMAGE YOU THINK THAT RIOT WON'T BUFF THEIR DAMAGE OUTPUT? 
you really need to be real once.

but i:

-do not shittalk the balance team, i do not insult any rioters even if i hate a few of them that i won't list
-do not write threads about how to fixe the game because I DO NOT KNOW how to do it

but if i see bruisers dealing no damage to tanks i will complain, but i won't know which change to do to fixe that issue

There's a difference between giving opinions and INSISTING that a champion or whatever gets nerfed because a certain player is just plain bad or doesn't understand a certain aspect of the game which is what mostly happens on the Boards. This way even the better players lose interest in trying to resolve the issue because the post is just pointless circle jerk.

We're talking as if Boards actually looks for advice. All that people do is bitch about whatever they lost to in their previous game which is what gives a nasty vibe to the comments that people leave. I yet have to see someone actually say something like "you're just trash" to a well thought out post asking for help and opinions.

I don't remember the context of the original quote, but the point I was trying to make was that the skill to be a good at a game and the skill to be able to balance the same game are different skills. I think some people assume that if you're good at a game, you must have a ton of knowledge about the game (which is probably true), and therefore a ton of insight into the game (which might be true), and therefore know how to solve problems and put things in a good direction (which might not be true). 

But if you are working on a game, I would definitely advocate that you play it. A lot. Playing it a lot isn't sufficient to balance it - you need a lot of information from other sources too. But not playing the game will likely leave you really out of touch.

I myself do not know how to fixe the game, when I say fixe the game i mean make it enjoyable for 100% of the community
it would be easy to just gut ADCS and make them unplayable, but it's not the goal of balance

Being good at the game is not enough, people like to quote DOPA but they don't tell you that he said ryze was garbage tier after rework, and that zoe was garbage on release.

The only thing being high elo changes is that you play a different meta than in low elo, in high elo the most broken midlaner is corki, in low elo the most broken midlaner is probably zed or yasuo

Right, with that being said I have to ask a question.

If mains that have play the same champs or lanes for 8 years and have gather tons of first hand experience will come and post on the boards just to get down voted and mocked.  Its like a journeyman laughing at a master trade crafter.  Sure, you might have a different way to approach the issues.  But it still makes the point that how they want the champ buff or they area it would impact is them expressing FREE good information.  Why don't you ever listen?

So here is someone that played EQ at the start.  Vumelin the necro (did complete all epic weapons and yea I saw there with the expension with a lot of XX's in all the names).  Then in WoW (our eq guild moved because of the awesome "Operation Pansy Stomp" happened.  Not with heavens of fire but was influential.  Busta my sham was the first to get Hammer of Rag on the server  (sure pissed a lot of people off but man pvp was fun)  Also had a lock (vumelin) / Pal (jmman) after a few expansion came out.  In Top ranked TN team for Halo invite to NY nationals, etc etc.  Now, I would be more than happy to help you verify any of this.

My point of this is I understand balancing, money, and fun.  As you can see I have had TOTAL changes in characters and how they work.  I have seen Multiple different styles and way games system interact.  They are all the same just a little different.  Sure I might not express or get the information across the way I have it in my mind all the time.  But Seeing all the down votes and post by red on things I feel I know 100% more than them on is heart breaking.  Sure I can't tell you about other champs really because I don't have 8 years in them as I do fiddle.  But how many fiddle questions have I been asked.... ZERO.  As an 8 year main why is my input or how I think about me have less barren than someone that has ZERO games on him and post a funny meme getting a lot of up votes.  (which I'm sure can be altered)

Plus number don't tell you happiness or how you feel playing a champ.

When a season 1 main post about his champ I don't tend to response because I now that person has a pretty good idea he know what he is talking about.  Sure the way to fix it might not be the best....BUT the area that needs fixing is usually right on.  I'm use an example.  See you nerf fiddle damage to minion.  (not getting into balance of it)  But then look what your going to do how.   Everyone lost -5ad, nerf wave clear for mages.  Now fiddle already had a bad time farming.  This also cares over to the jungle.  its just the way his spells work.  Instead of seeing how the wave clear changes and lose of ad works out you nerf him.  So once you nerf wave clear again this put a double nerf on a champ that already had a hard time with wave clear.  Does jungle wave clear..... sure late game.  The problem is you don't understand fiddle.  See he has high mana cost.  He isn't like other mages that spam for wave clear.  If you spam you need to only have 1 or 2 levels with does no real damage.  But if you do level it you have only have .75sec fear and a drain that only heal or do damage for shit.  This isn't a give him the minion damage back.  its I'm saying this is going to be a future problem with the upcoming wave clear changes (which I think needs to happen).  

In summation, If you want to nerf someone because of a high win rate and low play rate then nerf everyone with high win rates across the board.  If you want to nerf wave clear mid.  nerf it across the board not the struggling one and say Soon* on the rest.  If you say you want diversity don't nerf low play rate champs in other positions.  These are my issues.  Your are picking and choosing instead of a systemic process.  This leads people to saying Balance team doesn't know what they are doing.  And they are correct.  But without reason involved it becomes unreasonable.  My issues aren't fiddle was nerfed.  Its your reasoning behind it but leaving champs with high play rates and high win rates and saying they are just "fun" champs is honestly Bullshit.  Sure, I like flying a F-35 compared to a F-105D in a dog fight because its more "FUN" too.  Maybe you should have added more "fun" to the older kits or added less "fun" to the newer kits.  Fun = true damage, mobility, burst, safe farming, spelling doing multiple things.

Think about what you said then think about all the time I've been down vote from red and people that don't have one single game on fiddle.  Because I look people up to see.  Now i'm just waiting for the "hive" mind to tell me how they know more than me on a champ they have never played.

>and you STILL see people complaining about riot adding more damage to the game, are you fcking serious? you have A CLASS SUPPOSED TO DEAL DAMAGE NOT DOING DAMAGE YOU THINK THAT RIOT WON'T BUFF THEIR DAMAGE OUTPUT?

I think the real problem is their philosophy of making everyone equally broken. Bruisers should shit on tanks, bruisers don't -> powercreep bruisers instead of nerfing tanks. I'm not saying they aren't making bad decisions, they answered the relic adc meta quickly, made liandry a tank buster item instead of a burst squishies item, etc. But, in the long run, powercreeping everyone to ~ the same level is only hurting the game.

Part of this problem is that people still use the word "bruiser".  The bruiser champions of old went their separate ways, and are now the classes Juggernaut, Diver, and Skirmisher.  Each of these three classes has different capabilities, and not all should be strong against tanks.

Some champions that were or would have been bruisers back in the day do still destroy modern tanks with little to no issues.
Actually alL three of those classes should be good against tanks. Tanks shouldn't not 1v1 anyone in the game that isn't a marksmen or an assassin.

You're asking for tanks to only be viable as supports or junglers then, and if the parts that make them able to lane are nerfed they will drop out of jungle popularity just like last time.  Top lane tanks are a thing, and have been a thing since the fratmogs meta ended.

Each class has members that are good against tanks, but some classes have more members like that than others.  If you want to bust tanks don't pick a champion that isn't good against them, there are other options within those classes for you.
If people pick tanks top shouldn't they have a terrible laning experience if they scale later on? At least i think that's how it used to be.

We tried that.  The tanks fell behind to the point where they couldn't get the defensive items needed to survive the mid and early late game.  Early game champions destroyed them, so no one played tanks top.  A similar thing happened in the jungle.

I'm not saying we shouldn't try to make this happen, I'm only saying this is the price we have to pay for it.
